name: Obertal Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: When I got the Groupon for the Obertal, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. I had not yet visited Leavenworth since moving to Washington state, and I heard that it could be a bit of a tourist trap. Luckily, I did not feel duped by the Obertal in any way.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Set back away from the clamor of Rt. 2, the Obertal has a great location, with parking (some of which is covered) and in walking distance to the best of Leavenworth. When I checked in, the desk clerk was friendly, ran through the amenities, and was quite helpful on restaurant and bar recommendations. My king suite was on the third floor, and though there was no elevator, it was easy enough to get to. The room was updated in most ways one would want: newer TV, blu-ray player, updated bathroom, and fresh, clean linens. There was a fireplace in the room and starter logs and matches available for use.
reviews.title: clean, quiet, comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Though the neighbors were a bit rowdy in the early evening, nights were peaceful and quiet. When I woke each morning, I ate breakfast in the hotel lobby area, and I have to say - the breakfast was better than I could have hoped for: fresh fruit, waffles, yogurt, boiled eggs. This was no mere continental breakfast. The morning clerk was quite friendly and proud of the spread - as she should be.
reviews.title: Nice overnight ski trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My complaints were minor when I checked out (batteries dead in the remote, non-functioning fridge), but the clerk was beyond apologetic and asked me why I hadn't called immediately. I assured her they were not serious concerns, but it showed she cared.
reviews.title: Noisey, Noisey, Noisey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: All tolled, I would definitely book my next stay in Leavenworth at the Obertal. Great value.
reviews.title: Wonderful breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I got a ski package that included a stay at the Obertal inn. The owner was one who checked us in. He was super friendly. Knowing that this was a motor inn I expected the room to be just so-so. It was a lot better than I expected. It seems as they are in the process of redoing the hotel. The only bad part of our room was the bathroom. It looked very dated. The Breakfast was good. They had yogurt, cereal hot waffles and French toast. For the price of the lodging this place is worth the stay. Right downtown and friendly staff.
reviews.title: very friendly managment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spent a Saturday evening in Leavenworth. Arrived at Obartal Inn before arrival but luckily, there was availability to check-in early. The town is small and Obertal is in a great location to walk around as well as walk to the river. The staff was friendly and responsive. The Jacuzzi rooms have the undercover parking so that was nice. The weather was great and we had a great time.
reviews.title: A Good Night With Friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean and adequate, though the bathroom remodel was not finished (i.e. missing molding, hole in floor with exposed floor board). Customer service was ambivalent. Significant construction started at 9:30 AM.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We overheard the front desk receptionist answer a complaint call from a guest and she said, "sorry, this is the only time of year we can do this work." It was the answer I would have expected from her. When we turned in the keys to our room to check out she said, "you leaving? have a nice day". No, "how was your stay...hope you enjoyed it...please come back." Not a big deal, but it's usually customary at an inn/hotel.
reviews.title: The Good, the Bad, and the Average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the Obertal Inn has a lot of potential, but the management and service isn't sharp. The website really needs a face lift, and the copy just doesn't allow potential guests to give this place a chance. For example, the description on the breakfast page basically puts down the breakfast and states what the breakfast is lacking, rather than what it can offer (not to mention the description has a lot of run on sentences :-/ ). With that, a precedence was set for me to not like the breakfast. It was satisfactory.
reviews.title: Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the place, breakfast offerings, staff, coffee, location, location, location. Highly recommend staying here. AAA discounts offered.
reviews.title: Continuous Improvement and it shows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From the outside the Obertal looks like a bavarian motel. I was a little worried why I was spending $200 + on a motel room even if it was during the Lights Festival. I had a large deluxe room which I believe they consider a suite. It was surprisingly clean (especially given dogs are allowed in the rooms). The bed was very comfy - I slept great. The breakfast was better than your standard continental and all the staff was very friendly. The location is great - within walking distance to everything but not noisy. The only complaint was I could hear everything in the room above me; heels, muted talking and barking dogs. I called the front desk about the dogs and they had the owners return to the room to quiet them. I'll definetly be staying here again!
reviews.title: Great location, good breakfast, suprisingly clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the suites and were satisfied. The staff was friendly. Yes, it had a jacuzzi and a king size bed.... But some of the down sides; the walls seem paper thin. I've never heard through the wall of a hotel like this one, we could hear every foot step. Also the carpet was so dirty it was disgusting, it was a dark blue carpet too, so that means it was really stained. The outside looks Bavarian but the inside of the room didn't have a touch of bavarian-ness. We wanted the bavarian feel like the Alpine Rose Inn, we stayed there before and like it better.
reviews.title: No Bavarian Feel inside the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was pretty mid-range and the public areas were nothing special, but there are so many special touches to Obertal that we're likely to come back. It's about a block from all the winter wonderland action on Front Street and the hot tub is a nice treat after long cold walks around town. The complimentary breakfast is GOOD--fresh make-them-yourselves waffles with an array of sauces, including strawberry ginger. The thick cinnamon french toast is lovely. Hans recommended Mountain Springs Lodge for sleigh rides and snowmobiling and was kind enought to handle the reservations for us. It was wonderful--and he made it so easy. The tickets were waiting for us at the front desk along with directions to get there. He also recommended taking my son to Ski Hill for tubing, and it was awesome. We couldn't have had a better time both days.
reviews.title: Well-located and lots of nice touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Obertal Inn. The lady at the counter was very friendly and helpful, our room was ready early and it was clean, comfortable and quiet. But the best part was being able to bring our elderly small dog. It gave a peace of mind knowing we didn't have to leave him home - so we thank you for that! We will be recommending the Inn to friends and family and will stay again on our next trip.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Obertal Inn this weekend. We were warmly greeted by two ladies in the office who gave great advice as to what do to around town, restaurants, etc. The decor may come across as dated, but the room was very clean, had a comfortable bed, and had a nice Blueray/ flat screen combo. The complimentary breakfast downstairs looked delicious and full of options (waffles, oatmeal, cereal, fresh fruit, etc.), but because of our plans, we did not take advantage of it. You cannot beat the location - it is not on the main road so it is quiet, but in the heart of downtown and close to everything. Thanks for a fun stay, Obertal Inn! I will definitely recommend you if anyone asks about good Leavenworth accommodations!
reviews.title: Great Location! Clean rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: SIster and I stayed for a sisters trip. Kim was awesome with suggestions and giving us a great room. THe owner was very friendly and personable. They have the best continental breakfast I've had and I used to travel for work. Close to everything.... hot tub...... . They are still working on rooms and have great plans now that they are the new owners. The beds and pillows were wonderful.... very quiet room....We will be back AND THEY TAKE DOGS!!!. That is kudos in our book.
reviews.title: Great place, people and breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you and see ya again.
reviews.title: Stay? No way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good thing I can say about our room at the Obertal Inn is that it was clean. We were charged $676 for two nights during the last weekend of Oktoberfest. The room had peeling wallpaper, was on the 3rd floor (with no elevator), the bed was not very comfortable, and breakfast was served on paper plates with plastic utensils.
reviews.title: Dog Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Normally we stay at the Bavarian, but we wanted to bring our dog with us this time. The Bavarian costs about the same and is MUCH nicer! You also get a "real" breakfast, with biscuits and gravy, eggs, potatoes, etc. and you sit at a table with white tablecloths and you eat off of a real plate with proper utensils.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

description: Please accept a heartfelt welcome as we invite you to spend a night (or two or three) at the Obertal Inn; we are one block from everything in downtown Leavenworth, also known as "Little Bavaria." Explore the shops, enjoy fine European cuisine and soak up the tranquility of our beautiful village.Our tastefully appointed guest rooms have two Queen or one King bed. All rooms have a small refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, coffee maker, and LCD TV. High speed wireless internet is free for hotel guests and is available in every room. All King rooms have electric or wood burning fireplaces and have a 37” LCD TV with a Blu Ray DVD player. Two King rooms have Spa Tubs in the room to enjoy a luxurious soak after your busy day. Wake up to breathtaking mountain views and enjoy a wide variety of foods on our breakfast bar.
